class_example: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessati
english_translation: Indeed, venerable sir, the steward whom the venerable one has indicated has been instructed by me; let the venerable one approach him at a suitable time; he will clothe you with a robe.

class_example: ajja eva ātappaṃ karohi, ko jānāti maraṇaṃ suve
english_translation: Just make an effort today; who knows [if] death [is] tomorrow?

class_example: ye keci pāṇabhūtā atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā
english_translation: Whatever living beings there are, whether moving or not moving without exception.

class_example: atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etad’ahosi
english_translation: Then, this [thought] occurred to Venerable Ananda

class_example: mātari pitari ca, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye ca, tesu na mānaṃ karohi.
english_translation: Towards mother and father, and after that, towards the eldest brother; and towards the teacher. Do not show conceit towards them.

class_example: sukhassa dātā medhāvī sukhaṃ so adhigacchati
english_translation: The intelligent man [who is] a giver of happiness, acquires happiness.

class_example: sabbe dhammā anattā iti, yadā paññāya passati, atha nibbindati dukkhe – esa maggo visuddhiyā
english_translation: "All things are non-self." When one sees [this] with wisdom, then one is disenchanted with suffering. This is the path for purification.

class_example: ye keci pāṇabhūtā atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā
english_translation: Whatever living beings there are, whether moving or not moving without exception.

class_example: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, cakkhu niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti
english_translation: What do you think, Rāhula, “Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”

class_example: na bāhuṃ pacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdissāmi
english_translation: I will not sit in an inhabited area swinging [my] arm[s].

class_example: ime bhikkhave dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
english_translation: These things, o monks, are conducive for the non-decline of a monk who is a trainee.

class_example: ce so bhikkhu, pubbe appavārito, upasaṅkamissati cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjissati
english_translation: If that monk, previously uninvited, approaches [there], causes an alteration in a robe…

class_example: [One who is] sabbābhibhuṃ, all-knowing, wise, that man I call thus, “one who dwells alone.”
english_translation: [One who is] all-conquering, all-knowing, wise, that man I call thus, “one who dwells alone.”

class_example: bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati.
english_translation: A monk, gone to the forest or to the foot of a tree or to an empty dwelling, sits down.

class_example: bhikkhave, assutavā puthujjano na parimuccati jātiyā
english_translation: Monks, an unlearned common person is not liberated from birth.

class_example: “mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā”
english_translation: Venerables, don’t say anything to me, good or bad!

class_example: taco ca nahāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ
english_translation: Let [my] skin, sinew, and bone remain, let [my] flesh and blood dry up in [my] body.

class_example: sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ
english_translation: Living beings [who] have passed away from that group are returners, who come back to this existence.

class_example: sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ
english_translation: Living beings [who] have passed away from that group are returners, who come back to this existence.

class_example: ajja eva ātappaṃ karohi, ko jānāti maraṇaṃ suve
english_translation: Just make an effort today; who knows [if] death [is] tomorrow?

class_example: ce so bhikkhu, pubbe appavārito, upasaṅkamissati cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjissati
english_translation: If that monk, previously uninvited, approaches [there], causes an alteration in a robe…

class_example: “mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā”
english_translation: Venerables, don’t say anything to me, good or bad!

class_example: sabbe dhammā anattā iti, yadā paññāya passati, atha nibbindati dukkhe – esa maggo visuddhiyā
english_translation: "All things are non-self." When one sees [this] with wisdom, then one is disenchanted with suffering. This is the path for purification.

class_example: sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ
english_translation: Living beings [who] have passed away from that group are returners, who come back to this existence.

class_example: bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseti, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.
english_translation: [If any] monk expounds Dhamma to a woman by means of more than five or six sentences, except [together] with a knowledgeable male, [it is] an offence requiring confession.

class_example: mātāpitu upaṭṭhānaṃ, puttassa ca dārassa saṅgaho
english_translation: The looking after mother and father, the support of the wife and son.

class_example: taco ca nahāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsalohitaṃ
english_translation: Let [my] skin, sinew, and bone remain, let [my] flesh and blood dry up in [my] body.

class_example: ye dadanti upassayaṃ, tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca, sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati
english_translation: Whoever gives a dwelling, merit increases for them all the time, day and night.

class_example: upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti
english_translation: "He who is equanimous [and] mindful lives at ease."

class_example: sabbābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ, tam naraṃ ekavihārī iti ahaṃ brūmi
english_translation: [One who is] all-conquering, all-knowing, wise, that man I call thus, “one who dwells alone.”

class_example: atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etad’ahosi
english_translation: Then, this [thought] occurred to Venerable Ananda

class_example: sā devatā bhagavantaṃ etad’avoca
english_translation: The deity said this to the Blessed One.

class_example: atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etad’ahosi
english_translation: Then, this [thought] occurred to Venerable Ananda

class_example: esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho
english_translation: This community of the Blessed One’s disciples is worthy of offerings.

class_example: ehi tvaṃ bhikkhu bhojane mattaññū hohi
english_translation: Come, monk, be moderate with regard to food!

class_example: satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
english_translation: What should be done by a teacher for (his) disciples, that has been done by me for you.

class_example: satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
english_translation: What should be done by a teacher for (his) disciples, that has been done by me for you.

class_example: “mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā”
english_translation: Venerables, don’t say anything to me, good or bad!

class_example: mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ paricara
english_translation: You must minister to one like me, observing the moral practices, of upright nature, one living the holy life.

class_example: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessati

english_translation: Just make an effort today; who knows [if] death [is] tomorrow?

class_example: thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.
english_translation: An elder monk is dear to [his] fellow monks and pleasant, respected, and worthy of esteem [by them].

class_example: thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.
english_translation: An elder monk is dear to [his] fellow monks and pleasant, respected, and worthy of esteem [by them].

class_example: bhikkhū there sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti

class_example: dve kassakā bhātaro hatā, cattāro ca balibaddā
english_translation: Two farmers, [who are] brothers, and four oxen were killed.

class_example: nidhīnaṃ va pavattāraṃ, vajjadassinaṃ niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhajāhi
english_translation: Associate with an intelligent person, a wise man, one who reproves, who sees fault, he is (like) one who points out the treasure.

class_example: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, cakkhu niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā'ti
english_translation: What do you think, Rāhula, “Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”

class_example: nidhīnaṃ va pavattāraṃ, vajjadassinaṃ  niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhajāhi
english_translation: Associate with an intelligent person, a wise man, one who reproves, who sees fault, he is (like) one who points out the treasure.

english_translation: A monk, gone to the forest or to the foot of a tree or to an empty dwelling, sits down.

class_example: na bāhuṃ pacālakaṃ antaraghare nisīdissāmi
english_translation: I will not sit in an inhabited area swinging [my] arm[s].

class_example: bhikkhū hirimanto bhavissanti, ottappino bhavissanti, satimanto bhavissanti, paññavanto bhavissanti
english_translation: Monks should be conscientious, they should be feeling shame, they should be mindful, they should be wise.

class_example: sabbe dhammā anattā iti, yadā paññāya passati, atha nibbindati dukkhe – esa maggo visuddhiyā
english_translation: "All things are non-self." When one sees [this] with wisdom, then one is disenchanted with suffering. This is the path for purification.

english_translation: Associate with an intelligent person, a wise man, one who reproves, who sees fault, he is (like) one who points out the treasure.

english_translation: Senior monks of long-standing, [who] have been ordained for a long time, are fathers of the community of monks, guides of the community of monks.

english_translation: You must minister to one like me, observing the moral practices, of upright nature, one living the holy life.

class_example: mātari pitari ca, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye ca, tesu na mānaṃ karohi.
english_translation: Towards mother and father, and after that, towards the eldest brother; and towards the teacher. Do not show conceit towards them.

class_example: mātāpitu upaṭṭhānaṃ, puttassa ca dārassa saṅgaho
english_translation: The looking after mother and father, the support of the wife and son.

class_example: bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseti, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.
english_translation: [If any] monk expounds Dhamma to a woman by means of more than five or six sentences, except [together] with a knowledgeable male, [it is] an offence requiring confession.

class_example: Mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ paricara
english_translation: You must minister to one like me, observing the moral practices, of upright nature, one living the holy life.

class_example: mātari pitari ca, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye ca, tesu na mānaṃ karohi.
english_translation: Towards mother and father, and after that, towards the eldest brother; and towards the teacher. Do not show conceit towards them.

class_example: bhikkhū there sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti
english_translation: Monks will honor, respect, revere, [and] venerate the elders.

class_example: nidhīnaṃ va pavattāraṃ, vajjadassinaṃ niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhajāhi
english_translation: Associate with an intelligent person, a wise man, one who reproves, who sees fault, he is (like) one who points out the treasure.

class_example: “All things are non-self.” Yadā one sees [this] with wisdom, then one is disenchanted with suffering. This is the path for purification.
english_translation: “All things are non-self.” When one sees [this] with wisdom, then one is disenchanted with suffering. This is the path for purification.

class_example: yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, samaye corā balavanto honti..
english_translation: At whichever time, monks, thieves are powerful..

class_example: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessati
english_translation: Indeed, venerable sir, the steward whom the venerable one has indicated has been instructed by me; let the venerable one approach him at a suitable time; he will clothe you with a robe.

class_example: ye keci pāṇabhūtā atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā
english_translation: Whatever living beings there are, whether moving or not moving without exception.

class_example: ye keci pāṇabhūtā atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā
english_translation: Whatever living beings there are, whether moving or not moving without exception.

class_example: therā rattaññū ciraṃ pabbajitā saṅghassa pitaro saṅghassa pariṇāyakā
english_translation: Senior monks of long-standing, [who] have been ordained for a long time, are fathers of the community of monks, guides of the community of monks.

class_example: ye dadanti upassayaṃ, tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca, sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati
english_translation: Whoever gives a dwelling, merit increases for them all the time, day and night.

class_example: bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati.
english_translation: A monk, gone to the forest or to the foot of a tree or to an empty dwelling, sits down.

class_example: cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhanti
english_translation: A person with sight sees forms.

class_example: bhikkhū there sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti
english_translation: Monks will honor, respect, revere, [and] venerate the elders.

class_example: tena mahāsenena maccunā saṅgaro na hoti
english_translation: There is no bargaining with that death, with (his) great army.

class_example: mātāpitu upaṭṭhānaṃ, puttassa ca dārassa saṅgaho
english_translation: The looking after mother and father, the support of the wife and son.

class_example: therā rattaññū ciraṃ pabbajitā saṅghassa pitaro saṅghassa pariṇāyakā
english_translation: Senior monks of long-standing, [who] have been ordained for a long time, are fathers of the community of monks, guides of the community of monks.

class_example: therā rattaññū ciraṃ pabbajitā saṅghassa pitaro saṅghassa pariṇāyakā
english_translation: Senior monks of long-standing, [who] have been ordained for a long time, are fathers of the community of monks, guides of the community of monks.

class_example: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessati
english_translation: Indeed, venerable sir, the steward whom the venerable one has indicated has been instructed by me; let the venerable one approach him at a suitable time; he will clothe you with a robe.

class_example: bhikkhū hirimanto bhavissanti, ottappino bhavissanti, satimanto bhavissanti, paññavanto bhavissanti
english_translation: Monks should be conscientious, they should be feeling shame, they should be mindful, they should be wise.

class_example: Sattā tamhā kāyā cutā āgāmino honti āgantāro itthattaṃ
english_translation: Living beings [who] have passed away from that group are returners, who come back to this existence.

class_example: satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
english_translation: What should be done by a teacher for (his) disciples, that has been done by me for you.

class_example: satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
english_translation: What should be done by a teacher for (his) disciples, that has been done by me for you.

class_example: ye dadanti upassayaṃ, tesaṃ divā ca ratto ca, sadā puññaṃ pavaḍḍhati
english_translation: Whoever gives a dwelling, merit increases for them all the time, day and night.

class_example: sabbābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ, tam naraṃ ekavihārī iti ahaṃ brūmi
english_translation: [One who is] all-conquering, all-knowing, wise, that man I call thus, “one who dwells alone.”

class_example: seyyathāpi balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya
english_translation: Just like a strong man would stretch out (his) bent arm or …

class_example: esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho
english_translation: This community of the Blessed One’s disciples is worthy of offerings.

class_example: mādisaṃ sīlavantaṃ kalyāṇadhammaṃ brahmacāriṃ paricara
english_translation: You must minister to one like me, observing the moral practices, of upright nature, one living the holy life.

class_example: upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti
english_translation: “He who is equanimous [and] mindful lives at ease.”

class_example: sukhino vā khemino hontu sabbe sattā bhavantu sukhit'attā
english_translation: May all living beings be safe or at ease, may they be happy.

class_example: sukhino vā khemino hontu sabbe sattā bhavantu sukhit'attā
english_translation: May all living beings be safe or at ease, may they be happy.

class_example: bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati.
english_translation: A monk, gone to the forest or to the foot of a tree or to an empty dwelling, sits down.

class_example: sabbābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ, tam naraṃ ekavihārī iti ahaṃ brūmi
english_translation: [One who is] all-conquering, all-knowing, wise, that man I call thus, “one who dwells alone.”

class_example: ajja eva ātappaṃ karohi, ko jānāti maraṇaṃ suve
english_translation: Just make an effort today; who knows [if] death [is] tomorrow?

class_example: seyathāpi balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya
english_translation: Just like a strong man would stretch out (his) bent arm or …

class_example: nidhīnaṃ va pavattāraṃ, vajjadassinaṃ niggayhavādiṃ medhāviṃ paṇḍitaṃ bhajāhi
english_translation: Associate with an intelligent person, a wise man, one who reproves, who sees fault, he is (like) one who points out the treasure.

class_example: “mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā”
english_translation: Venerables, don’t say anything to me, good or bad!

class_example: ce so bhikkhu, pubbe appavārito, upasaṅkamissati cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjissati
english_translation: If that monk, previously uninvited, approaches [there], causes an alteration in a robe…

class_example: bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseti, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.
english_translation: [If any] monk expounds Dhamma to a woman by means of more than five or six sentences, except [together] with a knowledgeable male, [it is] an offence requiring confession.

class_example: sabbābhibhuṃ sabbaviduṃ sumedhaṃ, tam naraṃ ekavihārī iti ahaṃ brūmi
english_translation: [One who is] all-conquering, all-knowing, wise, that man I call thus, “one who dwells alone.”

class_example: yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamatu āyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessati
english_translation: Indeed, venerable sir, the steward whom the venerable one has indicated has been instructed by me; let the venerable one approach him at a suitable time; he will clothe you with a robe.

class_example: dve kassakā bhātaro hatā, cattāro ca balibaddā
english_translation: Two farmers, [who are] brothers, and four oxen were killed.

class_example: bhikkhū hirimanto bhavissanti, ottappino bhavissanti, satimanto bhavissanti, paññavanto bhavissanti
english_translation: Monks should be conscientious, they should be feeling shame, they should be mindful, they should be wise.
